intro: Psychotria macrophylla subsp. albicostata, commonly known as the white-costated psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves with prominent white veins, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered white flowers that are often fragrant. This species is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage.
